page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: Learning in Cookham Village was provided, from 1800 in simple High Street cottages, as a result of the influence of the then encumbant {Rev. {Brown.} In 1858 Holy Trinity Primary School was established, and by 1863 the Infant School rooms were erected at the sole expense of{'Misses Fleming'.} The school became 'controlled' by the Berkshire Education Authority in 1952. The present day school comprises the original buildings, although the headteacher's house has been swallowed up in the general running of the school and is now used for storage rooms, resource areas and staff facilities. Other buildings include; an administration block, hall and two classrooms; as well as, swimming pool, library, pavilion and two additional free-standing classrooms.
